sentences.sContent: The interview will last about two hours.
sentences.sCn: 面试大概要持续两小时。

sentences.sContent: I study for an hour every night.
I’ll be back in three hours .
Three hours later he was back.
Her bag was stolen within hours of her arrival.
sentences.sCn: 她才到没几个小时，手提包就被偷了。

sentences.sContent: You weren’t interested in my story a half hour ago.
sentences.sCn: 半小时之前你还对我讲的事情不感兴趣呢。

sentences.sContent: It takes about a quarter of an hour to walk into town.
sentences.sCn: 步行进城大约需要一刻钟。

sentences.sContent: The hotel is only an hour’s drive from the airport.
sentences.sCn: 那家宾馆离机场只有一小时的车程。

sentences.sContent: a top speed of 120 miles an hour
Please call during office hours.
There was a knock on the door in the early hours of the morning.
...A: One of the press operators arrived an hour and a half late...
...and that meant I had to leave an hour earlier than usual...
...who stayed up around an hour and a haft later on various days throughout the summer to watch the Cup...
...Russians also get up an hour later on International Women's Day...
...The most permissive said half an hour a day...
...Though they watched him every hour of the day...
...rush hour became radio's prime time...
...I give them a limit of half an hour and then stop...
...The author permits her children to use the screen for at most half an hour a day...
...Then it seems we'll have to meet an hour later at the library...

phrases.pCn: 交通拥挤时间；上下班高峰时间
地球一小时（全球环保行动）
n. 快乐时间；减价供应饮料等的时间（酒吧间术语）

words.tran: 每小时的，以钟点计算的；频繁的

trans.tranOther: a unit for measuring time. There are 60 minutes in one hour, and 24 hours in one day.
